references.text: Waypoints Vol 05: PPL/CPL Air Law. Chapter 2: The Aircraft

questions.question: What category of airworthiness certificate is required for aircraft used for Air Transport Operations (ATOs)?
Can an aircraft with a restricted category airworthiness certificate be used in an ATO or CTO? If yes, under what condition?
questions.answer: Yes, only for a CTO. The aircraft flight manual allows such an operation.

questions.question: What are the six category groups within the Special category?
questions.answer: Special - experimental. Special - exhibition. Special - amateur built. Special - primary. Special - light sport aircraft (LSA). Special - limited.

questions.question: When might a provisional airworthiness certificate be issued?
questions.answer: When the applicant has applied for a type certificate (or supplemental type certificate).

questions.question: When can an aircraft have airworthiness certificates in multiple categories, and which categories are these?
questions.answer: When the aircraft can be converted from one configuration to another by removing or adding equipment by simple mechanical means. Standard and restricted categories..
